description: This module studies important legal issues relevant to professionals in IT-intensive industries or organizations. Among the topics to be addressed are freedom of speech online; intellectual property of digital products and content; data privacy, IT service contracts, and regulation on e-commerce and intermediary, such as online marketplace and platform. The goal of the course is to provide basic background in these issues for non-lawyers. The course enables IT professionals to better handle their legal resources and better understand their commercial opportunities and challenges. Real-world cases will be used to demonstrate the applicability of the law in IT industries.
title: Legal Aspects of Information Technology
